1. Promoting sustainable transportation: Encouraging the use of bicycles or electric scooters in crowded areas or reducing the local speed limits are just a couple of ways to tackle air pollution from traffic on the island.

2. Recycling and waste management: Providing recycling bins in public places, and educating people about the importance of waste reduction and also creating a zero-waste plan could significantly reduce the amount of pollution that is created in Rhodes.

3. Supporting renewable energy: Invest in green energy production mechanisms, such as wind turbines or solar panels, as sources of clean energy to power the island.

4. Green building practices and standards: Encourage businesses and homeowners to employ energy-efficient building design and introduce ordinances that require green roof or rooftop solar panels in new constructions.

5. Education programs: Develop outreach and education initiatives to encourage residents and tourists to make eco-friendly choices to reduce the island's carbon footprint. This could include campaigns to discourage littering, promoting reusable bags or reusable water bottles, and creating climate-friendly habits among the local populace.

Overall, these kinds of initiatives could help reduce the levels of pollution in Rhodes while also promoting the tourism industry and environmental sustainability.
